text: Albert Edward Hankey (24 May 1914 – 1998) was an English footballer who played as a goalkeeper for Stoke City, Charlton Athletic, Southend United, and Tonbridge. ==Playing career== Hankey played for Stoke City, Charlton Athletic, and Southend United. He played four matches as a guest for Port Vale during World War II.
